author: lgo
msg: (read_DER_TLvalue): Parse tag 0x14 also as a string.

author: lgo
msg: Remove the type from the serf_ssl_bucket_t, as we already store it in the ssl
context object shared by both decrypt and encrypt bucket.
serf_bucket_ssl_encrypt_create): Don't set the type on the ssl bucket.

author: lgo
msg: The Secure Transport and Keychain Services API's only offer limited ways to
extract structured information from a SecCertificate object. That's unfortunate,
because we provide a lot of info to the application to validate server
The one way to get to all the info we currently require, is to use the API that
gives us the full DER-encoded data representing the certificate.
This change adds the code to parse a DER encoded structure, read all relevant
data types and stores them in the same dictionary format already used by the
* buckets/sectrans_x509_cert.c: New file, parses DER-encoded certificate.
(validate_server_certificate): OR for combining multiple flags works better
than AND. Create the new sectrans_certificate_t structure.
cert_subject): Implement using the DER X509 parser.
(set_allowed_cert_validation_modes): Add application_managed as one of the
available methods. We're not completely there yet, but getting closer.
